headline: Buffalo Ranch Chicken and Cheese Dip
description: This Buffalo ranch chicken dip has all the flavors of chicken wings baked together. Serve with scoop-shaped tortilla chips for a hearty, pleasing dip.
name: Buffalo Ranch Chicken and Cheese Dip

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix chicken, cream cheese, buffalo wing sauce, ranch dressing, and sour cream together in a large bowl; transfer to a 9x13-inch baking dish. Sprinkle Colby-Monterey Jack cheese evenly on top.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and lightly browned, 25 to 30 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips.

review.reviewBody: i doubled the batch and followed recipe. I used Franks wing sauce and it tasted too bland so I added some Tessemae's Buffalo sauce and a little celery seed. It was delicious!

I’d give this recipe 8 stars if I could, probably more. It is soooo good, I’ve memorized it. We usually end up cooking chicken breasts in a crockpot for some recipe, and save one for this recipe. I often use Franks Red Hot or Sweet Baby Rays Buffalo sauce. I also usually eat it with Tortilla chips, but red Doritos aren’t bad either. I’ve also made it with leftover grilled chicken and that was good, too. So far, I haven’t gone wrong with it. And I’m a huge buffalo wing fan, so this is right up my alley. One of my favorite snacks/mini meals to make. Perfect for movie night or when having company over.
Doubled the recipe and put in crockpot. Used Green Mill buffalo sauce. Was awesome!
It was great. I taught my 14 year old nephew how to make it and he loved it.
Very delicious and it makes quite a bit. Ate so much of this right out of the oven I couldn’t have room for dinner several hours later. Definitely recommend this!
Love it I just didn’t use sour cream I just used ranch dressing.
I love this!
this was fantastic I make it for every party I go to! i tweeked the amounts of ranch and hot sauce to taste but overall fantastic!

This is an amazing recipe! I made a couple of minor substitutes based on what I had at home, but otherwise followed the recipe exactly. Thanks so much for sharing such an easy, delicious buffalo chicken dip recipe! This is one of my new quick and easy appetizers to make for unexpected guests.
Everybody loved it and asked for real the recipe.
Yumm! I made it in the crock pot because I was in a rush. I threw it all together but I used a rotisserie chicken instead of canned chicken I think that's what made it so good!
I made ranch dip with a ranch packet and sour cream and topped it off with some salad dressing. So good!
Simple easy to follow recipe. My children enjoyed it.

My grand daughter made this last night to take to a college class get together. She used a rotissiere chicken and shredded it. She put it in a crock pot on low for a while then warm over night. She gave me a taste of it and I thought it was very good, looked up the recipe so I could make some of my own.
I tried this recipe because I was craving buffalo chicken dip and hate the stuff at the store and I fell in love! best buffalo dip I've ever had!!! great for football nights for sure!!!
It was alright. I didn't like the taste of salad dressing and cream cheese mixed with chicken.
So delicious and always a hit at any gathering!

I had a reopen for this dip that I lost. This was very close. I used pepper jack and cheddar cheese and an absolute must is Frank's Red Hot This gives it the best flavor. Make this all the time for any occasion or get together! Everyone loves it. Never any leftovers. Thanks for helping me!
I use blue cheese dressing instead of ranch. Adds a nice tang to the taste.
I make this all of the time! Follow the exact recipe! Its a family favorite.
Turned out great. I didn't use all that cheese though just sprinkled some on top no grease like some reviewd stated. Very good

10-16-15 ~ Whipped this up for Bosses Day carry-in at work. It was very well received. I liked the extra creaminess that the sour cream added. I mixed it up on the stovetop and put in in my small crockpot, knowing we would munch on it all day. Served it with celery sticks and pita chips.

I make this in a crock pot. I used canned chicken which actually tastes better for some reason, everything else is the same, except no sour cream. Also, Franks Buffalo Wing sauce. J made these adjustments through trial ad error!
This is amazing made it with canned chicken
Gave it 5 stars!! DELICIOUS just as it is!!!!!
My husband and I absolutely love this recipe!! We love making it for all our get together s. Even occasionally eat it for dinner!!!
I use taco seasoning instead of hot sauce. I don't eat spicy foods, very good dip! I use sharp and medium cheddar cheese.
Very delicious and easy! I made for a small get together and there wasn't hardly any left! I used the Frank's Hot Sauce as suggested and had a great flavor for this dish. I definitely recommend.

I had a 12.5 oz of canned chicken on hand, so I used that. Not as good a rotisserie or real chicken breast but still pretty good. I Mixed all the cheese in,...I had some shredded cheddar and 4 cheese Mexican. This all fit in a pie plate sized ceramic casserole. I Took it to a party and received good reviews. I also used lighter cream cheese and sour cream to cut down on calories and fat.

I make this all the time, just minus the sour cream (darned intolerance). The only thing I do different is I buy the pre-cooked grilled chicken breast strips in 1 lb packages from Costco cause I'm lazy and just chop it up.
It is my 'go-to' dip recipe for gatherings or Football Sundays. Everyone always loves it and asks for the recipe.

So Good! My fiance and I have tried a recipe similar to this before and didn't care for the buffalo wing sauce so I used 1/4 cup of wing sauce and 1/4 cup of chipotle sauce and rotisserie chicken I had no trouble with it being greasy and it was delicious and had an awesome kick! Definately making this again!

This came out really greasy...we drained a lot of orange grease from the top before we ate it, after we ate it to put it away, and again when we reheated it and was still greasy. Maybe we used the wrong sauce...we used Sweet Baby Ray's buffalo wing sauce and it's the only thing we think the grease could have come from. Maybe we will try it again with a different sauce, but sure wouldn't make it again as we tried it.

I baked chicken breast, adding hot sauce to them and a little Lawry's seasoning, cooled and shredded. This was a great way to get teenage boys to eat raw veges. Very good dip, served with sugar snap peas, carrots and celery. Gone and requested for next "overnight".
Best dip!!! I always have requests for this one

Best buffalo chicken dip recipe yet! I used the breast meat from a store bought fresh cooked rotisserie chicken. I needed mine to be warm throughout a Super Bowl party so cooked it at 350 for 15 minutes and then put it in a little crockpot on "low" for the remainder of the afternoon. Yum!!!

Turned out excellent! I didn't really measure the sour cream or ranch, just kind of eyeballed it. Threw it all in my little crockpot. Everyone enjoyed it! Making it again this weekend, and maybe for the Superbowl also!
I have made this twice. Loved it both times. Instead of chicken breast, I make a small chicken and shred that or by an already made chicken at the grocery store.
Had some leftover chicken breast so I made this recipe. Didn't change a thing and we loved it...thanks

Instead of using prepared ranch dressing, I increased the amount of sour cream and used a homemade dry ranch dressing mix. I did not try this myself but my boys RAVED about it. It lasted about 15 minutes, then it was gone.

item.name: Buffalo Ranch Chicken and Cheese Dip
